text:
30.
Appendix A
PROGRAM
NAEB Region I Conference
April 8-9, 1955
WELCOME TO DELEGATES
Dear Colleague:
We take this opportunity to invite you and your associates to attend
the first annual Region I NAEB Conference, to be held at the University of
Massachusetts, April 8 and 9, 1955*
The Purpose of this regional meeting is to give the NAEB members in
Region I an opportunity to discuss common problems, ask pertinent questions of
headquarters representatives, get complaints off their chestsâ€”in other words,
a family "bull session.11 This meeting brings together NAEBers from Connecticut,
Delaware, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York,
Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Vermont in addition to the headquarters staff from
Urbana, Illinois.
We extend to you a hearty invitation to attend this conference and
earnestly hope it will contribute to the personal achievement, in the Radio-TV
field, of every individual participating.
In general, NAEB members have stated that this is the type of thing
they want, and what they have gotten most out of at other regional meetings.
THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE
THURSDAY. APRIL 7
5:00 P.M. NAEB delegates please report after 5:00 P.M. to Knowlton House,
Route 116, Campus of University of Massachusetts, where lodging
will be assigned. Pre-registrants arriving late will find a note
at the registration desk telling room assignment by name. All
delegates will meet at Skinner Auditorium on Route 116 on Friday,
April 8.
